text: Greatest Hits is a compilation album by the Canadian-American rock group The Band. It was released in 2000 on Capitol Records. The album was released in conjunction with remastered versions of the group's first four albums. It draws very heavily from these records, with thirteen of the eighteen tracks selected from Music from Big Pink, The Band, Stage Fright and Cahoots. ==Track listing== All tracks composed by Robbie Robertson unless otherwise noted. ==Group members and other participants== *John Simon - producer (tracks 1-8) *The Band - producers (tracks 9-18) *Rick Danko - bass, fiddle, vocals (except track 14) *Levon Helm - drums, mandolin, rhythm guitar, bass, tambourine, vocals *Garth Hudson - organ, piano, synthesizers, accordion, clavinet, wind instruments, bagpipe chanter, bass pedals *Richard Manuel - piano, drums, clavinet, organ, harmonica, vocals *Robbie Robertson - guitars *John Simon - tuba, tenor saxophone, electric piano, baritone horn (tracks 2, 3, 7 and 8) *Allen Toussaint - horn arrangements (track 12) *Billy Mundi - drums (track 14) *Byron Berline - fiddle (track 17) *See individual albums for engineering credits. ==References== Category:2000 greatest hits albums Category:Albums produced by John Simon (record producer) Category:The Band compilation albums Category:Capitol Records compilation albums
